central_boiler.title: Control of the central boiler
central_boiler.description:
Enter the services to call to turn on/off the central boiler. The service called must be formatted as follows: `entity_id/service_name[/attribute:value]` (/attribute:value is optional)
For example:
- to turn on a switch: `switch.controle_chaudiere/switch.turn_on`
- to turn off a switch: `switch.controle_chaudiere/switch.turn_off`
- to program the boiler to 25° and thus force its ignition: `climate.thermostat_chaudiere/climate.set_temperature/temperature:25`
- to send 10° to the boiler and thus force its extinction: `climate.thermostat_chaudiere/climate.set_temperature/temperature:10` [![?](https://img.icons8.com/color/18/help.png)](https://github.com/jmcollin78/versatile_thermostat/blob/main/documentation/fr/feature-central-boiler.md)

data_description.central_boiler_activation_service: Command to turn-on the central boiler formatted like entity_id/service_name[/attribut:valeur]
data_description.central_boiler_deactivation_service: Command to turn-off the central boiler formatted like entity_id/service_name[/attribut:valeur]
data_description.central_boiler_activation_delay_sec: Delay in seconds before activating the central boiler when it needs to be turned on

valve_regulation.description: Configuration for self-regulation with direct control of the valve [![?](https://img.icons8.com/color/18/help.png)](https://github.com/jmcollin78/versatile_thermostat/blob/main/documentation/en/self-regulation.md#auto-régulation-par-contrôle-direct-de-la-vanne)

data_description.offset_calibration_entity_ids: The list of the 'offset calibration' entities. Set it if your TRV has the entity for better regulation. There should be one per underlying climate entities
data_description.opening_degree_entity_ids: The list of the 'opening degree' entities. There should be one per underlying climate entities
data_description.closing_degree_entity_ids: The list of the 'closing degree' entities. Set it if your TRV has the entity for better regulation. There should be one per underlying climate entities
data_description.proportional_function: Algorithm to use (TPI is the only one for now)
data_description.opening_threshold_degree: Valve opening value under which the valve should be considered as closed (and then 'max_closing_degree' will apply)
data_description.min_opening_degrees: Opening degree minimum value for each underlying device when previous threshold is exceeded, comma separated. Default to 0. Example: 20, 25, 30
data_description.max_opening_degrees: Opening degree maximum value. The valve will never open more than this value
data_description.max_closing_degree: Closing degree maximum value. The valve will never be closed above this value. Set it to 100 to fully close the valve

auto_tpi_configuration.title: Auto TPI - Configuration
auto_tpi_configuration.description: General settings for Auto TPI learning.

data_description.auto_tpi_learning_type: Choose 'Discovery' for initial startup (Weighted Average, weight 1) or 'Fine Tuning' for continuous adjustments (EWMA, Alpha 0.08).
data_description.heater_cooling_time:
Time to cool down after stop (minutes)

| Type | Heating time | Cooling time |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Electric radiator | 5mn | 7mn |
| Water radiator | 15mn | 20mn |
| Underfloor heating | 30mn | 45mn |
data_description.auto_tpi_heating_rate: Radiator temperature rise capacity ({unit} per hour). Leave at 0 for automatic learning (bootstrap).
data_description.auto_tpi_aggressiveness: Reduction factor for learned coefficients (50-100%). Lower values result in more conservative coefficients and reduce overshoot risk.
data_description.auto_tpi_enable_advanced_settings: Check to access parameter fine-tuning (Alpha, Decay, Weight).

data_description.auto_tpi_avg_initial_weight: Weight of the initial/previous value in the average calculation

auto_tpi_ema_settings.title: Auto TPI - EWMA
auto_tpi_ema_settings.description:
Parameters for EWMA method.

Recommendations:
| Situation | Alpha (ema_alpha) | Decay Rate (ema_decay_rate) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Initial Learning | 0.15 | 0.08 |
| Fine Learning | 0.08 | 0.12 |
| Continuous Learning | 0.05 | 0.02 |

data_description.auto_tpi_ema_decay_rate: Rate at which Alpha decreases over time (stabilization)

sync_device_internal_temp.title: Synchronize device internal temperature
sync_device_internal_temp.description: Configuration to synchronize the internal temperature of the underlying devices with selected entities [![?](https://img.icons8.com/color/18/help.png)](https://github.com/jmcollin78/versatile_thermostat/blob/main/documentation/en/feature-sync_device_temp.md)

data_description.sync_with_calibration: Check to apply the offset calibration when synchronizing the internal temperature. Uncheck to directly copy the temperature from the selected entities
data_description.sync_entity_ids: The list of the entities used to synchronize the internal temperature of the underlying devices. There should be one per underlying device. Should be a calibration entity if checkbox is selected or a temperature entity otherwise. Both are `number` entities.

heating_failure_detection.title: Heating failure detection
heating_failure_detection.description: Configure the heating failure detection feature. This detects anomalies when heating is expected but temperature doesn't increase, or when heating is off but temperature keeps rising.

data.use_heating_failure_detection_central_co: Use central heating failure detection configuration

data_description.use_heating_failure_detection_feature: Enable the detection of heating anomalies for VTherms with TPI
data_description.use_heating_failure_detection_central_co: Check to use the central heating failure detection configuration. Uncheck to use specific parameters for this VTherm
data_description.heating_failure_threshold: On percent threshold above which heating should cause temperature increase (0.9 = 90%)
data_description.cooling_failure_threshold: On percent threshold below which temperature should not increase (0.0 = 0%)
data_description.heating_failure_detection_delay: Time in minutes to wait before checking if temperature has changed as expected
data_description.temperature_change_tolerance: Minimum temperature change in degrees to consider significant. Smaller changes are ignored to filter sensor noise (default: 0.5°C)
data_description.failure_detection_enable_template: An optional Jinja2 template that must return True to enable detection. Useful to temporarily disable detection when an external heat source is active (e.g., `is_state('binary_sensor.wood_stove', 'off')` in double curly braces). If empty, detection is always enabled.

error.window_open_detection_method: Only one window open detection method should be used. Use either window sensor or automatic detection through temperature threshold but not both
error.no_central_config: You cannot check 'use central configuration' because no central configuration was found. You need to create a Versatile Thermostat of type 'Central Configuration' to use it.
error.service_configuration_format: The format of the service configuration is wrong
error.valve_regulation_nb_entities_incorrect: The number of valve entities for valve regulation should be equal to the number of underlyings
error.sync_device_internal_temp_nb_entities_in: The number of entities for synchronize device internal temperature should be equal to the number of underlyings
error.min_opening_degrees_format: A comma separated list of positive integer is expected. Example: 20, 25, 30
error.max_opening_degrees_format: A comma separated list of positive integer between 0 and 100 is expected. Example: 80, 85, 90
error.min_max_opening_degrees_inconsistent: For each underlying device, max_opening_degrees must be strictly greater than min_opening_degrees. Please check your configuration.
error.vswitch_configuration_incorrect: The command customization configuration is incorrect. It is required for underlying entities that are not switches, and the format must be service_name[/attribute:value]. More information is available in the README

auto_tpi_configuration.description: General settings for Auto TPI learning.

data_description.auto_tpi_learning_type: Choose 'Discovery' for initial startup (Weighted Average, weight 1) or 'Fine Tuning' for continuous adjustments (EWMA, Alpha 0.08).
data_description.auto_tpi_heating_rate: Radiator temperature rise capacity ({unit} per hour). Leave at 0 for automatic learning (bootstrap).
data_description.heater_cooling_time:
Time to cool down after stop (minutes)

| Type | Heating time | Cooling time |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Electric radiator | 5mn | 7mn |
| Water radiator | 15mn | 20mn |
| Underfloor heating | 30mn | 45mn |
data_description.auto_tpi_aggressiveness: Reduction factor for learned coefficients (50-100%). Lower values result in more conservative coefficients and reduce overshoot risk.
data_description.auto_tpi_enable_advanced_settings: Check to modify the parameters of the chosen algorithm.

data_description.auto_tpi_avg_initial_weight: Initial weight of existing coefficients in the average calculation (1-50 is typical). Higher weight means slower and more stable learning.

auto_tpi_ema_settings.title: Auto TPI - EWMA - {name}
auto_tpi_ema_settings.description:
Parameters for EWMA method.

Recommendations:
| Situation | Alpha (ema_alpha) | Decay Rate (ema_decay_rate) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Strong adjustments | 0.15 | 0.08 |
| Fine tuning | 0.08 | 0.12 |

data_description.auto_tpi_ema_decay_rate: Rate at which Alpha decreases over time (stabilization)

heating_failure_detection.title: Heating failure detection - {name}
heating_failure_detection.description: Configure the heating failure detection feature. This detects anomalies when heating is expected but temperature doesn't increase, or when heating is off but temperature keeps rising.

data.use_heating_failure_detection_central_co: Use central heating failure detection configuration

data_description.use_heating_failure_detection_feature: Enable the detection of heating anomalies for VTherms with TPI
data_description.use_heating_failure_detection_central_co: Check to use the central heating failure detection configuration. Uncheck to use specific parameters for this VTherm
data_description.heating_failure_threshold: On percent threshold above which heating should cause temperature increase (0.9 = 90%)
data_description.cooling_failure_threshold: On percent threshold below which temperature should not increase (0.0 = 0%)
data_description.heating_failure_detection_delay: Time in minutes to wait before checking if temperature has changed as expected
data_description.temperature_change_tolerance: Minimum temperature change in degrees to consider significant. Smaller changes are ignored to filter sensor noise (default: 0.5°C)
data_description.failure_detection_enable_template: An optional Jinja2 template that must return True to enable detection. Useful to temporarily disable detection when an external heat source is active (e.g., `is_state('binary_sensor.wood_stove', 'off')` in double curly braces). If empty, detection is always enabled.

error.window_open_detection_method: Only one window open detection method should be used. Use either window sensor or automatic detection through temperature threshold but not both
error.no_central_config: You cannot check 'use central configuration' because no central configuration was found. You need to create a Versatile Thermostat of type 'Central Configuration' to use it.
error.service_configuration_format: The format of the service configuration is wrong
error.valve_regulation_nb_entities_incorrect: The number of valve entities for valve regulation should be equal to the number of underlyings
error.sync_device_internal_temp_nb_entities_in: The number of entities for synchronize device internal temperature should be equal to the number of underlyings
error.min_opening_degrees_format: A comma separated list of positive integer is expected. Example: 20, 25, 30
error.max_opening_degrees_format: A comma separated list of positive integer between 0 and 100 is expected. Example: 80, 85, 90
error.min_max_opening_degrees_inconsistent: For each underlying device, max_opening_degrees must be strictly greater than min_opening_degrees. Please check your configuration.
error.vswitch_configuration_incorrect: The command customization configuration is incorrect. It is required for underlying entities that are not switches, and the format must be service_name[/attribute:value]. More information is available in the README

set_auto_tpi_mode.name: Set Auto TPI mode
set_auto_tpi_mode.description: Enable or disable the Auto TPI learning mode

auto_tpi_mode.name: Auto TPI mode
auto_tpi_mode.description: Enable (true) or disable (false) the Auto TPI learning

reinitialise.name: Reset learning data
reinitialise.description: Reset all learning data when enabling Auto TPI mode (default is true)

reset_auto_tpi_capacities.name: Reset Auto TPI Capacities
reset_auto_tpi_capacities.description: Reset the learned maximum heating and cooling capacities to 1.0 °C/h. Learned coefficients are NOT reset.

auto_tpi_calibrate_capacity.name: Auto Tpi Calibrate Capacity
auto_tpi_calibrate_capacity.description: Calibrate the heating/cooling capacity (in °C/hour) using linear regression on the entity's history data. Learned coefficients are NOT updated.

start_date.name: History from date
start_date.description: Date from which to retrieve history (default is 30 days ago)

end_date.name: History to date
end_date.description: Date until which to retrieve history (default is now)

hvac_mode.name: HVAC Mode
hvac_mode.description: Which mode to calibrate (heat or cool).

save_to_config.name: Save to Config
save_to_config.description: Apply the calculated capacity to the Auto TPI configuration.

min_power_threshold.name: Minimum Power Threshold
min_power_threshold.description: Minimum power percentage to consider a cycle as saturated (default 95%). Lower values will include more cycles but may be less accurate.

minimal_activation_delay.name: Minimal Activation delay
minimal_activation_delay.description: Delay in seconds under which the equipment will not be activated

minimal_deactivation_delay.name: Minimal Deactivation delay
minimal_deactivation_delay.description: Delay in seconds under which the equipment will be kept active

tpi_threshold_low.name: Low TPI threshold
tpi_threshold_low.description: Threshold in ° under which the TPI algorithm will be on. 0 means no threshold

tpi_threshold_high.name: High TPI threshold
tpi_threshold_high.description: Threshold in ° above which the TPI algorithm will be off. 0 means no threshold

lock.name: Lock
lock.description: Locks the thermostat, preventing any changes to its configuration from UI or automations.

unlock.name: Unlock
unlock.description: Unlocks the thermostat, allowing changes to its configuration.

auto_tpi_learning_stopped.message: Auto TPI learning for {name} has been stopped due to 3 consecutive failures. Reason: {reason}. Please check your configuration.
